Position acquisition period while in sos
Number of acquisitions on motion start event
Number of acquisitions on motion stop event
Position acquisition period while acquiring consecutive positions on motion start or stop

Select the GNSS hold on mode. Possible Values are:
0: Disabled
1: Always. Hold-on mode always set. Only controlled by the timer.
2: techno: If the gnss is actually used (meaning GNSS techno not skipped).
3: moving: Hold-mode set while moving.
4: techno and moving: if the gnss is actually used (meaning GNSS techno not skipped) and tracker is moving.
GNSS hold on mode timeout.

Time to wait before retrying to connect the main network. Applicable when the tracker is static.
Duration between each attempts reconnect the main network. Applicable when the tracker is static.

Max time to wait for joining the network. The value 0 disables the timer.
Period at which an heartbeat notification is sent to trigger a Rx window for downlinks (if no uplink has been sent within this period). 0 disable the function.

firmwareParameters.description: Time between link-check requests
Socket 1. Transmission strategy

properties.name: ADREnabled
properties.description: true: to enable the LoRa network ADR if the tracker is static. false: to disable the network ADR regardless the motion state of the tracker

properties.name: dualTransmissionInStaticEnabled
properties.description: Control the dual transmission when the tracker is static. true: to enable the dual transmission in static state. false: to disable it

properties.name: dualTransmissionInMotionEnabled
properties.description: Control the dual transmission when the tracker is in motion. true: to enable the dual transmission in motion state. false: to disable it in motion state.

properties.name: dataRateModification
properties.description: Control the DR (Datarate) modification for over-sized messages. true: to allow AOS to adapt the DR for messages not fitting the allowed size for a given datarate.false: to prevent sending of over-sized messages

properties.name: dr0
properties.description: false: dr0 is disabled. true: dr0 is enabled.

properties.description: false: dr1 is disabled. true: dr1 is enabled.

Sim interface.
Network type
Radio frequency bands scanned to search a cell.
Duration during which the modem searches for a cellular network. Applicable when the tracker is static.
Duration during which the modem searches for a cellular network. Applicable when the tracker is motion.
Duration let to the modem to automatically recover the network after a network lost.
Number of times the network search is repeated before shutting down the modem.
String providing the service access point name. If not provided, this information is retrieve from the SIM.
Cellular operator name when using the SIM0
Cellular operator name when using the SIM1 (E.SIM).
Low power mode
Bit-field giving the requested TAU period.
Bit-field giving the requested active time.
Requested paging cycle length
Requested paging time window
RAI (Release Assistance Indication) timeout. A null value disables the feature. Use only with UDP protocol.
Number of echo-request sent before declaring the network as lost. Set 0 to disable the feature.
Time between echo-request, or since the last downlink activity.
Socket 1 transport protocol
Socket 1 remote IP address or URL in string format (max 32 bytes)
Socket 1 destination UDP/TCP port
Socket 1 local UDP/TCP port number. Value 0 means that the modem will choose one.
Duration in second for which the messages are hold in the socket 1 transmit queue before being transmitted
String specifying the user identifier for private APN
String specifying the user password for private APN
String specifying the user password for private APN
